intro: Diodia latiflora, commonly known as broadleaf diodia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy and have a distinct aromatic scent. Its small, white to pinkish flowers are clustered in umbels, and it produces small, dry fruits called capsules. Diodia latiflora is often found in moist, open habitats such as sandy soils and disturbed areas.
